pullrequest.title: surface: expand documentation of friction and slip coefficients

content.raw:
this parameter is defined in the `ode` block, and the `Collide` function is a callback for ODE users to combine surface properties between two colliding objects. Each object defines its own surface properties, but for each contact you need one set of parameters for the solver. The callback lets the user decide how to combine them, for example, taking the lower of two friction values.

Gazebo does this in [ODEPhysics::Collide](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/3ca3431cfe5ac0de875fc93ceb95484c38d6a4c5/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ODEPhysics.cc-1003).

This probably could be phrased better.
content.html:
this parameter is defined in the ode block, and the Collide function is a callback for ODE users to combine surface properties between two colliding objects. Each object defines its own surface properties, but for each contact you need one set of parameters for the solver. The callback lets the user decide how to combine them, for example, taking the lower of two friction values.

Gazebo does this in ODEPhysics::Collide.

This probably could be phrased better.
